using System;
using System.Linq.Expressions;

public partial record struct UserSummary(int Id, string FirstName, string LastName, string Email, bool IsActive);

{

    /// <summary>

    /// </summary>
    /// <param name="source">The source <see cref="global::User"/> object to copy data from.</param>
    public UserSummary(global::User source) : this(source.Id, source.FirstName, source.LastName, source.Email, source.IsActive)
    {
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="UserSummary"/> class with default values.
    /// </summary>
    /// <remarks>
    /// This constructor is useful for unit testing, object initialization, and scenarios
    /// where you need to create an empty instance and populate properties later.
    /// </remarks>
    public UserSummary() : this(0, string.Empty, string.Empty, string.Empty, false)
    {
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Gets the projection expression for converting <see cref="global::User"/> to <see cref="UserSummary"/>.
    /// Use this for LINQ and Entity Framework query projections.
    /// </summary>
